page.title: 16CHANGES IN STEWARTBY
page.content: were being kept in the dark. However, the view of younger residents was more optimistic, believing that the opportunity to buy a home of their own would lead to an influx of new people into the village, giving it a more exciting identity. 3. {Effects on the village Since its inception in 1926 the company always possessed a paternalistic affection for the village, hence, the idea of a "family village" set out on a "garden plan". Often the company took care of the houses and provided for the general maintenance of the village. However, recently this attitude has been changing. With the sale of houses the company has taken the view that the village should be run by the individual homeowners with the traditional functions of the parish
